column9: The user recovers 1/2 the HP lost by the target, rounded down. If Big Root is held by the user, the HP recovered is 1.3x normal, rounded down.
Has a 10% chance to lower the target's Special Defense by 1 stage.
Raises the user's Defense by 2 stages.

Raises a random stat by 2 stages as long as the stat is not already at stage 6. The user can choose to use this move on itself or an ally. Fails if no stat stage can be raised or if the user or ally has a substitute.
This move does not check accuracy.
Has a higher chance for a critical hit.
Raises the user's Speed by 2 stages.
Has a higher chance for a critical hit.
Has a 30% chance to make the target flinch.
Raises the user's Special Defense by 2 stages.
Has a 10% chance to raise the user's Attack, Defense, Special Attack, Special Defense, and Speed by 1 stage.
No additional effect.

The user has 1/16 of its maximum HP, rounded down, restored at the end of each turn while it remains active. If Big Root is held by the user, the HP recovered is 1.3x normal, rounded half down. If the user uses Baton Pass, the replacement will receive the healing effect.
No additional effect.

Hits two to five times. Has a 3/8 chance to hit two or three times, and a 1/8 chance to hit four or five times. If one of the hits breaks the target's substitute, it will take damage for the remaining hits. If the user has the Skill Link Ability, this move will always hit five times. If the target has a Focus Sash and had full HP when this move started, it will not be knocked out regardless of the number of hits.
Every Pokemon in the user's party is cured of its non-volatile status condition.

A random move among those known by the user's party members is selected for use. Does not select Assist, Chatter, Copycat, Counter, Covet, Destiny Bond, Detect, Endure, Feint, Focus Punch, Follow Me, Helping Hand, Me First, Metronome, Mimic, Mirror Coat, Mirror Move, Protect, Sketch, Sleep Talk, Snatch, Struggle, Switcheroo, Thief, or Trick.
Power doubles if the target has already taken damage this turn.
Has a 30% chance to make the target flinch.
Has a higher chance for a critical hit.

Causes the target to become infatuated, making it unable to attack 50% of the time. Fails if both the user and the target are the same gender, if either is genderless, or if the target is already infatuated. The effect ends when either the user or the target is no longer active. Pokemon with the Oblivious Ability are immune.
This move does not check accuracy.
Has a 10% chance to lower the target's Attack by 1 stage.
Power doubles if the user was hit by a Pokemon in the target's position this turn.

Hits two to five times. Has a 3/8 chance to hit two or three times, and a 1/8 chance to hit four or five times. If one of the hits breaks the target's substitute, it will take damage for the remaining hits. If the user has the Skill Link Ability, this move will always hit five times. If the target has a Focus Sash and had full HP when this move started, it will not be knocked out regardless of the number of hits.
Raises the user's Defense by 2 stages.
The user is replaced with another Pokemon in its party. The selected Pokemon has the user's stat stage changes, confusion, and certain move effects transferred to it.

Deals typeless damage. Hits one time for the user and one time for each unfainted Pokemon without a non-volatile status condition in the user's party. For each hit, the damage formula uses the participating Pokemon's base Attack as the Attack stat, the target's base Defense as the Defense stat, and ignores stat stages and other effects that modify Attack or Defense; each hit is considered to come from the user.
Raises the user's Attack by 12 stages in exchange for the user losing 1/2 of its maximum HP, rounded down. Fails if the user would faint or if its Attack stat stage is 6.

The user spends two turns locked into this move and then, on the second turn after using this move, the user attacks the last Pokemon that hit it, inflicting double the damage in HP it lost to attacks during the two turns. If the last Pokemon that hit it is no longer active, the user attacks a random opposing Pokemon instead. If the user is prevented from moving during this move's use, the effect ends. This move does not check accuracy and ignores type immunity.

Prevents the target from switching for two to five turns (always five turns if the user is holding Grip Claw). Causes damage to the target equal to 1/16 of its maximum HP, rounded down, at the end of each turn during effect. The target can still switch out if it is holding Shed Shell or uses Baton Pass or U-turn. The effect ends if either the user or the target leaves the field, or if the target uses Rapid Spin or Substitute successfully. This effect is not stackable or reset by using this or another binding move.
Has a 30% chance to make the target flinch.
If this move is successful, the user must recharge on the following turn and cannot select a move.
Has a 10% chance to burn the target and a higher chance for a critical hit.
Has a 10% chance to freeze the target. If the weather is Hail, this move does not check accuracy.

Prevents the target from switching out. The target can still switch out if it is holding Shed Shell or uses Baton Pass or U-turn. If the target leaves the field using Baton Pass, the replacement will remain trapped. The effect ends if the user leaves the field, unless it uses Baton Pass, in which case the target will remain trapped.
Has a 30% chance to paralyze the target.
Has a 10% chance to make the target flinch.

Hits two to five times. Has a 3/8 chance to hit two or three times, and a 1/8 chance to hit four or five times. If one of the hits breaks the target's substitute, it will take damage for the remaining hits. If the user has the Skill Link Ability, this move will always hit five times. If the target has a Focus Sash and had full HP when this move started, it will not be knocked out regardless of the number of hits.

Hits twice. If the first hit breaks the target's substitute, it will take damage for the second hit. If the target has a Focus Sash and had full HP when this move started, it will not be knocked out regardless of the number of hits.

Has a 30% chance to paralyze the target. This attack charges on the first turn and executes on the second. On the first turn, the user avoids all attacks other than Gust, Sky Uppercut, Thunder, and Twister, and Gust and Twister have doubled power when used against it. If the user is holding a Power Herb, the move completes in one turn.
If the target lost HP, the user takes recoil damage equal to 1/3 the HP lost by the target, rounded down, but not less than 1 HP.
If this attack does not miss and whether or not the target is immune, the effects of Reflect and Light Screen end for the target's side of the field before damage is calculated.
Power doubles if the target has less than or equal to half of its maximum HP remaining.
Has a 10% chance to lower the target's Speed by 1 stage.
Has a 10% chance to lower the target's Speed by 1 stage.

The user steals the target's held Berry if it is holding one and eats it immediately, gaining its effects unless the user's item is being ignored. Items lost to this move can be regained with Recycle.
Has a 10% chance to lower the target's Special Defense by 1 stage.
Raises the user's Attack and Defense by 1 stage.
No additional effect.

Hits two to five times. Has a 3/8 chance to hit two or three times, and a 1/8 chance to hit four or five times. If one of the hits breaks the target's substitute, it will take damage for the remaining hits. If the user has the Skill Link Ability, this move will always hit five times. If the target has a Focus Sash and had full HP when this move started, it will not be knocked out regardless of the number of hits.
Raises the user's Special Attack and Special Defense by 1 stage.
The user's type changes based on the battle terrain. Normal type on the regular Wi-Fi terrain. Fails if the user has the Multitype Ability or if the type is one of the user's current types.

Lowers the target's Special Attack by 2 stages. The target is unaffected if both the user and the target are the same gender, or if either is genderless. Pokemon with the Oblivious Ability are immune.
Raises the user's Special Defense by 1 stage. If the user uses an Electric-type attack on the next turn, its power will be doubled.
Has a 70% chance to raise the user's Special Attack by 1 stage.
Lowers the target's Attack by 2 stages.

Has an X% chance to confuse the target, where X is 0 unless the user is a Chatot that hasn't Transformed. If the user is a Chatot, X is 1, 11, or 31 depending on the volume of Chatot's recorded cry, if any; 1 for no recording or low volume, 11 for medium volume, and 31 for high volume.

Prevents the target from switching for two to five turns (always five turns if the user is holding Grip Claw). Causes damage to the target equal to 1/16 of its maximum HP, rounded down, at the end of each turn during effect. The target can still switch out if it is holding Shed Shell or uses Baton Pass or U-turn. The effect ends if either the user or the target leaves the field, or if the target uses Rapid Spin or Substitute successfully. This effect is not stackable or reset by using this or another binding move.
Lowers the user's Defense and Special Defense by 1 stage.

Hits two to five times. Has a 3/8 chance to hit two or three times, and a 1/8 chance to hit four or five times. If one of the hits breaks the target's substitute, it will take damage for the remaining hits. If the user has the Skill Link Ability, this move will always hit five times. If the target has a Focus Sash and had full HP when this move started, it will not be knocked out regardless of the number of hits.
Causes the target to become confused.
Has a 10% chance to confuse the target.
Has a 10% chance to lower the target's Speed by 1 stage.

The user's type changes to match the original type of one of its known moves besides this move and Curse, at random, but not either of its current types. Fails if the user cannot change its type, or if this move would only be able to select one of the user's current types.

The user's type changes to match a type that resists or is immune to the type of the last move used against the user, if it was successful against the user, but not either of its current types. The determined type of the move is used rather than the original type. Fails if the last move used against the user was not successful, if the user has the Multitype Ability, or if this move would only be able to select one of the user's current types.

The user uses the last move used by any Pokemon, including itself. Fails if no move has been used, or if the last move used was Assist, Chatter, Copycat, Counter, Covet, Destiny Bond, Detect, Endure, Feint, Focus Punch, Follow Me, Helping Hand, Me First, Metronome, Mimic, Mirror Coat, Mirror Move, Protect, Sketch, Sleep Talk, Snatch, Struggle, Switcheroo, Thief, or Trick.
Raises the user's Defense and Special Defense by 1 stage.
Lowers the target's Speed by 2 stages.

Deals damage to the last opposing Pokemon to hit the user with a physical attack this turn equal to twice the HP lost by the user from that attack. If that opposing Pokemon's position is no longer in use and there is another opposing Pokemon on the field, the damage is done to it instead. Only the last hit of a multi-hit attack is counted. Fails if the user was not hit by an opposing Pokemon's physical attack this turn, or if the user did not lose HP from the attack.

If this attack was successful and the user has not fainted, it steals the target's held item if the user is not holding one. The target's item is not stolen if it is a Mail or Griseous Orb, or if the target has the Multitype Ability. Items lost to this move cannot be regained with Recycle.
Has a higher chance for a critical hit.
Has a higher chance for a critical hit.
Has a 10% chance to poison the target and a higher chance for a critical hit.
Has a 20% chance to lower the target's Defense by 1 stage.
Has a 50% chance to lower the target's Defense by 1 stage.
Power is equal to 120 * (target's current HP / target's maximum HP) + 1, rounded down.

If the user is not a Ghost type, lowers the user's Speed by 1 stage and raises the user's Attack and Defense by 1 stage. If the user is a Ghost type, the user loses 1/2 of its maximum HP, rounded down and even if it would cause fainting, in exchange for the target losing 1/4 of its maximum HP, rounded down, at the end of each turn while it is active. If the target uses Baton Pass, the replacement will continue to be affected. Fails if there is no target or if the target is already affected or has a substitute.
No additional effect.
Has a 20% chance to make the target flinch.
Causes the target to fall asleep.
Raises the user's Defense and Special Defense by 1 stage.
Raises the user's Defense by 1 stage. As long as the user remains active, the power of the user's Ice Ball and Rollout will be doubled (this effect is not stackable).

Lowers the target's evasiveness by 1 stage. If this move is successful and whether or not the target's evasiveness was affected, the effects of Reflect, Light Screen, Safeguard, Mist, Spikes, Toxic Spikes, and Stealth Rock end for the target's side. Ignores a target's substitute, although a substitute will still block the lowering of evasiveness.
Until the user's next turn, if an opposing Pokemon's attack knocks the user out, that Pokemon faints as well, unless the attack was Doom Desire or Future Sight.

The user is protected from most attacks made by other Pokemon during this turn. This move has a 1/X chance of being successful, where X starts at 1 and doubles each time this move is successfully used, up to a maximum of 8. X resets to 1 if this move fails or if the user's last move used is not Detect, Endure, or Protect. Fails if the user moves last this turn.

This attack charges on the first turn and executes on the second. On the first turn, the user avoids all attacks other than Earthquake and Magnitude, which have doubled power when used against it, and is also unaffected by weather. If the user is holding a Power Herb, the move completes in one turn.

For 4 to 7 turns, the target's last move used becomes disabled. Fails if one of the target's moves is already disabled, if the target has not made a move, if the target no longer knows the move, or if the move has 0 PP.
Has a 30% chance to paralyze the target.

This attack charges on the first turn and executes on the second. On the first turn, the user avoids all attacks other than Surf and Whirlpool, which have doubled power when used against it, and is also unaffected by weather. If the user is holding a Power Herb, the move completes in one turn.
Has a 20% chance to confuse the target.

Deals typeless damage that cannot be a critical hit two turns after this move is used. Damage is calculated against the target on use, and at the end of the final turn that damage is dealt to the Pokemon at the position the original target had at the time. Fails if this move or Future Sight is already in effect for the target's position.

Hits twice. If the first hit breaks the target's substitute, it will take damage for the second hit. If the target has a Focus Sash and had full HP when this move started, it will not be knocked out regardless of the number of hits.

Hits twice. If the first hit breaks the target's substitute, it will take damage for the second hit. If the target has a Focus Sash and had full HP when this move started, it will not be knocked out regardless of the number of hits.

Hits two to five times. Has a 3/8 chance to hit two or three times, and a 1/8 chance to hit four or five times. If one of the hits breaks the target's substitute, it will take damage for the remaining hits. If the user has the Skill Link Ability, this move will always hit five times. If the target has a Focus Sash and had full HP when this move started, it will not be knocked out regardless of the number of hits.
Raises the user's evasiveness by 1 stage.
If the target lost HP, the user takes recoil damage equal to 1/3 the HP lost by the target, rounded down, but not less than 1 HP.
Lowers the user's Special Attack by 2 stages.
Has a 30% chance to paralyze the target.
No additional effect.
Raises the user's Attack and Speed by 1 stage.
No additional effect.
Deals 40 HP of damage to the target.
Has a 20% chance to make the target flinch.
The user recovers 1/2 the HP lost by the target, rounded down. If Big Root is held by the user, the HP recovered is 1.3x normal, rounded down.

The target is unaffected by this move unless it is asleep and does not have a substitute. The user recovers 1/2 the HP lost by the target, rounded down, but not less than 1 HP. If Big Root is held by the user, the HP recovered is 1.3x normal, rounded down.
No additional effect.
Has a 100% chance to confuse the target.
Has a 10% chance to lower the target's Special Defense by 1 stage.
Power doubles if the target is using Dig.
No additional effect.

For 5 turns, the target's held item has no effect. An item's effect of causing forme changes is unaffected, but any other effects from such items are negated. During the effect, Fling and Natural Gift are prevented from being used by the target. Items thrown at the target with Fling will still activate for it. If the target uses Baton Pass, the replacement will remain unable to use items.
Has a 10% chance to burn the target.

For 4 to 8 turns, the target is forced to repeat its last move used. If the affected move runs out of PP, the effect ends. Fails if the target is already under this effect, if it has not made a move, if the move has 0 PP, or if the move is Encore, Mimic, Mirror Move, Sketch, Struggle, or Transform.
Deals damage to the target equal to (target's current HP - user's current HP). The target is unaffected if its current HP is less than or equal to the user's current HP.

The user will survive attacks made by other Pokemon during this turn with at least 1 HP. This move has a 1/X chance of being successful, where X starts at 1 and doubles each time this move is successfully used, up to a maximum of 8. X resets to 1 if this move fails or if the user's last move used is not Detect, Endure, or Protect. Fails if the user moves last this turn.
Has a 10% chance to lower the target's Special Defense by 1 stage.
Power is equal to (user's current HP * 150 / user's maximum HP), rounded down, but not less than 1.

The user faints after using this move, unless this move has no target. The target's Defense is halved during damage calculation. This move is prevented from executing if any active Pokemon has the Damp Ability.
Has a 10% chance to make the target flinch.
No additional effect.
Power doubles if the user is burned, paralyzed, or poisoned.
Has a 100% chance to make the target flinch. Fails unless it is the user's first turn on the field.
Lowers the target's Special Defense by 2 stages.
Leaves the target with at least 1 HP.
Lowers the target's Attack by 2 stages.
Fails unless the target is using Detect or Protect. If this move is successful, it breaks through the target's Detect or Protect for this turn, allowing other Pokemon to attack the target normally.
This move does not check accuracy.
Has a 10% chance to burn the target.
Has a 10% chance to burn the target and a 10% chance to make it flinch. This move can hit Pokemon with the Wonder Guard Ability regardless of their typing.
Has a 10% chance to burn the target.

Prevents the target from switching for two to five turns (always five turns if the user is holding Grip Claw). Causes damage to the target equal to 1/16 of its maximum HP, rounded down, at the end of each turn during effect. The target can still switch out if it is holding Shed Shell or uses Baton Pass or U-turn. The effect ends if either the user or the target leaves the field, or if the target uses Rapid Spin or Substitute successfully. This effect is not stackable or reset by using this or another binding move.

Deals damage to the target equal to the target's maximum HP. Ignores accuracy and evasiveness modifiers. This attack's accuracy is equal to (user's level - target's level + 30)%, and fails if the target is at a higher level. Pokemon with the Sturdy Ability are immune.

The power of this move is 20 if X is 43 to 48, 40 if X is 22 to 42, 80 if X is 13 to 21, 100 if X is 6 to 12, 150 if X is 2 to 5, and 200 if X is 0 or 1, where X is equal to (user's current HP * 64 / user's maximum HP), rounded down.
Has a 10% chance to burn the target.
Has a 10% chance to burn the target.
Has a 10% chance to burn the target. If the target lost HP, the user takes recoil damage equal to 1/3 the HP lost by the target, rounded down, but not less than 1 HP.
Lowers the target's accuracy by 1 stage.
Has a 10% chance to lower the target's Special Defense by 1 stage.
Raises the target's Special Attack by 1 stage and confuses it.

The power of this move is based on the user's held item. The held item is lost and it activates for the target if applicable. If the target avoids this move by protecting itself, the user's held item is still lost. The user can regain a thrown item with Recycle. Fails if the user has no held item, if the held item cannot be thrown, or if the user is under the effect of Embargo.

This attack charges on the first turn and executes on the second. On the first turn, the user avoids all attacks other than Gust, Sky Uppercut, Thunder, and Twister, and Gust and Twister have doubled power when used against it. If the user is holding a Power Herb, the move completes in one turn.
Has a 10% chance to lower the target's Special Defense by 1 stage.
Raises the user's chance for a critical hit by 2 stages. Fails if the user already has the effect. Baton Pass can be used to transfer this effect to an ally.
The user loses its focus and does nothing if it is hit by a damaging attack this turn before it can execute the move, but it still loses PP.

Until the end of the turn, all single-target attacks from the opposing side are redirected to the user. Such attacks are redirected to the user before they can be reflected by Magic Coat, or drawn in by the Lightning Rod or Storm Drain Abilities. This effect remains active even if the user leaves the field. Fails if it is not a Double Battle.
Has a 30% chance to paralyze the target.

As long as the target remains active, its evasiveness stat stage is ignored during accuracy checks against it if it is greater than 0, and Normal- and Fighting-type attacks can hit the target if it is a Ghost type.
If this move is successful, the user must recharge on the following turn and cannot select a move.
Power is equal to the greater of ((255 - user's Happiness) * 2/5), rounded down, or 1.

Hits two to five times. Has a 3/8 chance to hit two or three times, and a 1/8 chance to hit four or five times. If one of the hits breaks the target's substitute, it will take damage for the remaining hits. If the user has the Skill Link Ability, this move will always hit five times. If the target has a Focus Sash and had full HP when this move started, it will not be knocked out regardless of the number of hits.
Power doubles with each successful hit, up to a maximum of 160 power. The power is reset if this move misses or another move is used.

Hits two to five times. Has a 3/8 chance to hit two or three times, and a 1/8 chance to hit four or five times. If one of the hits breaks the target's substitute, it will take damage for the remaining hits. If the user has the Skill Link Ability, this move will always hit five times. If the target has a Focus Sash and had full HP when this move started, it will not be knocked out regardless of the number of hits.

Deals typeless damage that cannot be a critical hit two turns after this move is used. Damage is calculated against the target on use, and at the end of the final turn that damage is dealt to the Pokemon at the position the original target had at the time. Fails if this move or Doom Desire is already in effect for the target's position.

Causes the target's Ability to be rendered ineffective as long as it remains active. If the target uses Baton Pass, the replacement will remain under this effect. If the target's Ability is Multitype or Stance Change, this move fails, and receiving the effect through Baton Pass ends the effect immediately.
The user recovers 1/2 the HP lost by the target, rounded down. If Big Root is held by the user, the HP recovered is 1.3x normal, rounded down.
If this move is successful, the user must recharge on the following turn and cannot select a move.
Paralyzes the target.

This move's power is 20 if the target weighs less than 10 kg, 40 if less than 25 kg, 60 if less than 50 kg, 80 if less than 100 kg, 100 if less than 200 kg, and 120 if greater than or equal to 200 kg.
Causes the target to fall asleep.

For 5 turns, the evasiveness of all active Pokemon is multiplied by 0.6. At the time of use, Bounce, Fly, and Magnet Rise end immediately for all active Pokemon. During the effect, Bounce, Fly, High Jump Kick, Jump Kick, Magnet Rise, and Splash are prevented from being used by all active Pokemon. Ground-type attacks, Spikes, Toxic Spikes, and the Arena Trap Ability can affect Flying types or Pokemon with the Levitate Ability. Fails if this move is already in effect.
Lowers the target's Attack by 1 stage.
Raises the user's Special Attack by 1 stage.
Until the user's next turn, if an opposing Pokemon's attack knocks the user out, that move loses all its remaining PP.
The user swaps its Defense and Special Defense stat stage changes with the target.

Deals damage to the target equal to the target's maximum HP. Ignores accuracy and evasiveness modifiers. This attack's accuracy is equal to (user's level - target's level + 30)%, and fails if the target is at a higher level. Pokemon with the Sturdy Ability are immune.
Has a 30% chance to poison the target.
Power doubles if the target is using Bounce or Fly.
Power is equal to (25 * target's current Speed / user's current Speed) + 1, rounded down, but not more than 150. If the user's current Speed is 0, it is treated as 1 instead.

For 5 turns, the weather becomes Hail. At the end of each turn except the last, all active Pokemon lose 1/16 of their maximum HP, rounded down, unless they are an Ice type or have the Ice Body, Magic Guard, or Snow Cloak Abilities. Lasts for 8 turns if the user is holding Icy Rock. Fails if the current weather is Hail.
Lowers the user's Speed by 1 stage.
Raises the user's Defense by 1 stage.
Resets the stat stages of all active Pokemon to 0.
If the target lost HP, the user takes recoil damage equal to 1/2 the HP lost by the target, rounded down, but not less than 1 HP.
Has a 30% chance to make the target flinch.
Every Pokemon in the user's party is cured of its non-volatile status condition. Pokemon with the Soundproof Ability are not cured.

For 5 turns, the target is prevented from restoring any HP as long as it remains active. During the effect, healing moves are unusable, move effects that grant healing will not heal, but Abilities and items will continue to heal the user. If an affected Pokemon uses Baton Pass, the replacement will remain under the effect. Pain Split is unaffected.
The user restores 1/2 of its maximum HP, rounded down.

The user faints and the Pokemon brought out to replace it has its HP fully restored along with having any non-volatile status condition cured. The new Pokemon is sent out immediately and the healing happens after hazards take effect. Fails if the user is the last unfainted Pokemon in its party.
The user swaps all its stat stage changes with the target.
Has a 10% chance to burn the target.

The power of the target's attack this turn is multiplied by 1.5 (this effect is stackable). Fails if there is no ally adjacent to the user or if the ally already moved this turn, but does not fail if the ally is using a two-turn move.
This move's type and power depend on the user's individual values (IVs). Power varies between 30 and 70, and type can be any but Normal.

If this attack is not successful, the user loses HP equal to half the target's maximum HP if the target was immune, rounded down, otherwise half of the damage the target would have taken, rounded down, but no less than 1 HP and no more than half of the target's maximum HP, as crash damage. Pokemon with the Magic Guard Ability are unaffected by crash damage.
No additional effect.

Deals damage to the target equal to the target's maximum HP. Ignores accuracy and evasiveness modifiers. This attack's accuracy is equal to (user's level - target's level + 30)%, and fails if the target is at a higher level. Pokemon with the Sturdy Ability are immune.
Raises the user's Attack by 1 stage.
If this move is successful, the user must recharge on the following turn and cannot select a move.
No additional effect.

No additional effect.
Causes the target to fall asleep.

If this move is successful, the user is locked into this move and cannot make another move until it misses, 5 turns have passed, or the attack cannot be used. Power doubles with each successful hit of this move and doubles again if Defense Curl was used previously by the user. If this move is called by Sleep Talk, the move is used for one turn.
Has a 10% chance to freeze the target.
Has a 10% chance to freeze the target and a 10% chance to make it flinch.
Has a 10% chance to freeze the target.
No additional effect.

Hits two to five times. Has a 3/8 chance to hit two or three times, and a 1/8 chance to hit four or five times. If one of the hits breaks the target's substitute, it will take damage for the remaining hits. If the user has the Skill Link Ability, this move will always hit five times. If the target has a Focus Sash and had full HP when this move started, it will not be knocked out regardless of the number of hits.
Has a 100% chance to lower the target's Speed by 1 stage.
The user prevents all opposing Pokemon from using any moves that the user also knows as long as the user remains active. Fails if no opposing Pokemon know any of the user's moves.

The user has 1/16 of its maximum HP restored at the end of each turn, but it is prevented from switching out and other Pokemon cannot force the user to switch out. The user can still switch out if it uses Baton Pass or U-turn. If the user leaves the field using Baton Pass, the replacement will remain trapped and still receive the healing effect. During the effect, the user can be hit normally by Ground-type attacks and be affected by Spikes and Toxic Spikes, even if the user is a Flying type or has the Levitate Ability.
Raises the user's Defense by 2 stages.
Has a 30% chance to make the target flinch.
Has a 30% chance to lower the target's Defense by 1 stage.
This move's type depends on the user's held Plate.

If this attack is not successful, the user loses HP equal to half the target's maximum HP if the target was immune, rounded down, otherwise half of the damage the target would have taken, rounded down, but no less than 1 HP and no more than half of the target's maximum HP, as crash damage. Pokemon with the Magic Guard Ability are unaffected by crash damage.
Has a higher chance for a critical hit.
Lowers the target's accuracy by 1 stage.

The target's held item is lost for the rest of the battle, unless the item is a Griseous Orb or the target has the Multitype or Sticky Hold Abilities. During the effect, the target cannot obtain a new item by any means.
This move fails unless the user knows this move and at least one other move, and has used all the other moves it knows at least once each since it became active or Transformed.
Has a 30% chance to burn the target.
Has a higher chance for a critical hit.
Lowers the user's Special Attack by 2 stages.
The user recovers 1/2 the HP lost by the target, rounded down. If Big Root is held by the user, the HP recovered is 1.3x normal, rounded down.

The Pokemon at the user's position steals 1/8 of the target's maximum HP, rounded down, at the end of each turn. If Big Root is held by the recipient, the HP recovered is 1.3x normal, rounded half down. If the target uses Baton Pass, the replacement will continue being leeched. For 5 turns, the user and its party members take 1/2 damage from special attacks, or 2/3 damage if there are multiple active Pokemon on the user's side. Critical hits ignore this effect. If the user leaves the field using Baton Pass, this effect is restarted against the same target for the replacement. The effect ends if either the user or the target leaves the field.

Has a 30% chance to paralyze the target. This move can hit a target using Bounce or Fly. If the weather is Rain Dance, this move does not check accuracy. If the weather is Sunny Day, this move's accuracy is 50%.
Has a 10% chance to paralyze the target and a 10% chance to make it flinch.
Has a 10% chance to paralyze the target.
Has a 10% chance to paralyze the target.
Paralyzes the target. This move does not ignore type immunity.
Has a 10% chance to paralyze the target.
Lowers the target's Attack and Defense by 1 stage.
Prevents the target from selecting the same move for use two turns in a row. This effect ends when the target is no longer active.
Badly poisons the target.

Sets up a hazard on the opposing side of the field, poisoning each opposing Pokemon that switches in, unless it is a Flying-type Pokemon or has the Levitate Ability. Can be used up to two times before failing. Opposing Pokemon become poisoned with one layer and badly poisoned with two layers. Can be removed from the opposing side if any opposing Pokemon uses Rapid Spin successfully, is hit by Defog, or a grounded Poison-type Pokemon switches in. Safeguard prevents the opposing party from being poisoned on switch-in, as well as switching in with a substitute.

The user transforms into the target. The target's current stats, stat stages, types, moves, Ability, weight, IVs, species, and sprite are copied. The user's level and HP remain the same and each copied move receives only 5 PP. This move fails if the target has transformed.
Has a 20% chance to either burn, freeze, or paralyze the target.

The user swaps its held item with the target's held item. Fails if either the user or the target is holding a Mail or Griseous Orb, if neither is holding an item, if either has the Multitype Ability, if either is under the effect of Knock Off, or if the target has the Sticky Hold Ability.
For 5 turns, all active Pokemon with lower Speed will move before those with higher Speed, within their priority brackets. If this move is used during the effect, the effect ends.

Hits three times. Power increases to 20 for the second hit and 30 for the third. This move checks accuracy for each hit, and the attack ends if the target avoids a hit. If one of the hits breaks the target's substitute, it will take damage for the remaining hits. If the target has a Focus Sash and had full HP when this move started, it will not be knocked out regardless of the number of hits.

The power of this move is based on the amount of PP remaining after normal PP reduction and the Pressure Ability resolve. 200 power for 0 PP, 80 power for 1 PP, 60 power for 2 PP, 50 power for 3 PP, and 40 power for 4 or more PP.

Hits twice, with each hit having a 20% chance to poison the target. If the first hit breaks the target's substitute, it will take damage for the second hit. If the target has a Focus Sash and had full HP when this move started, it will not be knocked out regardless of the number of hits.
Has a 20% chance to make the target flinch. Power doubles if the target is using Bounce or Fly.

If this move is successful and the user has not fainted, the user switches out even if it is trapped and is replaced immediately by a selected party member. The user does not switch out if there are no unfainted party members.

The user spends three to six turns locked into this move. This move targets an opponent at random on each turn. During effect, no active Pokemon can fall asleep by any means, and Pokemon that are already asleep wake up as their turn starts or at the end of each turn, including the last one. If the user is prevented from moving or the attack is not successful against the target during one of the turns, the effect ends.
No additional effect.
No additional effect.
No additional effect.
This move does not check accuracy.
Has a 10% chance to paralyze the target. If the target lost HP, the user takes recoil damage equal to 1/3 the HP lost by the target, rounded down, but not less than 1 HP.
Power doubles if the target is asleep. If this move is successful, the target wakes up.
No additional effect.
Has a 20% chance to confuse the target.

While the user is active, all Fire-type attacks used by any active Pokemon have their power halved. Fails if this effect is already active for the user. Baton Pass can be used to transfer this effect to an ally.
Power is equal to (user's current HP * 150 / user's maximum HP), rounded down, but not less than 1.
Has a 20% chance to make the target flinch.
Power doubles if a weather condition is active, and this move's type changes to match. Ice type during Hail, Water type during Rain Dance, Rock type during Sandstorm, and Fire type during Sunny Day.

Prevents the target from switching for two to five turns (always five turns if the user is holding Grip Claw). Causes damage to the target equal to 1/16 of its maximum HP, rounded down, at the end of each turn during effect. The target can still switch out if it is holding Shed Shell or uses Baton Pass or U-turn. The effect ends if either the user or the target leaves the field, or if the target uses Rapid Spin or Substitute successfully. This effect is not stackable or reset by using this or another binding move.

The target is forced to switch out and be replaced with a random unfainted ally. Fails if the target is the last unfainted Pokemon in its party, if the target used Ingrain previously or has the Suction Cups Ability, or if the user's level is lower than the target's and X * (user's level + target's level) / 256 + 1 is less than or equal to (target's level / 4), rounded down, where X is a random number from 0 to 255.
Burns the target.
No additional effect.
At the end of the next turn, the Pokemon at the user's position has 1/2 of its maximum HP restored to it, rounded down. Fails if this move is already in effect for the user's position.
Raises the user's Defense by 1 stage.
If the target lost HP, the user takes recoil damage equal to 1/3 the HP lost by the target, rounded down, but not less than 1 HP.
Causes the target's Ability to become Insomnia. Fails if the target's Ability is Multitype or Truant, or if the target is holding a Griseous Orb.

Prevents the target from switching for two to five turns (always five turns if the user is holding Grip Claw). Causes damage to the target equal to 1/16 of its maximum HP, rounded down, at the end of each turn during effect. The target can still switch out if it is holding Shed Shell or uses Baton Pass or U-turn. The effect ends if either the user or the target leaves the field, or if the target uses Rapid Spin or Substitute successfully. This effect is not stackable or reset by using this or another binding move.
Power is equal to 120 * (target's current HP / target's maximum HP) + 1, rounded down.
No additional effect.

Causes the target to fall asleep at the end of the next turn. Fails when used if the target cannot fall asleep or if it already has a non-volatile status condition. At the end of the next turn, if the target is still active, does not have a non-volatile status condition, and can fall asleep, it falls asleep. If the target becomes affected, this effect cannot be prevented by Safeguard or a substitute, or by falling asleep and waking up during the effect.
Has a 100% chance to paralyze the target.
Has a 20% chance to make the target flinch.
